Title: Waste Doubled
HoverDescription: Municipal Solid Waste generation levels are expected to double by the year 2025 ( 2.2 billion tonnes per year).

Title: Costs
HoverDescription: Solid waste management costs are expected to increase from today's (2012) amount of $205.4 billion to $375.5 billion in 2025.

Title: King of Waste Production
HoverDescription: China surpasses the US as the world's largest waste generator.

Title: Projected Waste Growth in China
HoverDescription: It is projected that China will produce twice as much municipal solid waste as the United States.

Title: Current Stats
HoverDescription: Currently, almost 1.3 billion tonnes of MSW are generated globally every year, or 1.2 kg/capita/day.

Title: USA Waste
HoverDescription: Americans generated about 251 million tons of trash.

Title: US Recycle and Compost
HoverDescription: 89 million tons of municipal solid waste were recycled and composted that year.

Title: Recycling Rate
HoverDescription: Since 2012, the highest recycling rates are in Europe (30%) and China (25%). In the United States, the rate is at 9%.

Title: Plastic Facts
HoverDescription: If the trend continues, humans will have produced 34 billion tons of plastic by 2050.

Title: World Plastic Growth
HoverDescription: Global production of plastic increased from 2 million tons in 1950 to 380 million tons by 2015.

Title: Ocean Waste
HoverDescription: 8 million tons of plastic enters the global ocean each year, with nearly half of that originating from a handful of rapidly developing countries in Asia.

Title: Pollution
HoverDescription: Pollution is one of the biggest global killers, affecting over 100 million people. That's comparable to global diseases like malaria and HIV

Title: Ocean Runoff
HoverDescription: the National Academy of Sciences estimated that ocean-based sources, such as cargo ships and cruise liners had dumped 14 billion pounds of garbage into the ocean.

Title: Animal Death
HoverDescription: Over 1 million seabirds and 100,000 sea mammals are killed by pollution every year.

Title: Gulf of Mexico Pollution
HoverDescription: Every year, about 1.5 million metric tons of nitrogen pollution is carried into the Gulf of Mexico by the Mississippi River. It creates a "dead zone" about the size of New Jersey.

Title: Impact on Children
HoverDescription: While children make up 10% of the world's population, over 40% of the global burden of disease falls on them. 3 million children under age five die annually from environmental factors.

Title: Benefits of Recycling
HoverDescription: Recycling and composting prevented 85 million tons of material away from being disposed of in 2010, up from 18 million tons in 1980.
